thinking.disposable_income: Albany Park has a median household income of around $53,000, lower than Chicago's average. About 16% of residents live below poverty level, indicating limited disposable income for many households
thinking.discretionary_consumption: Given the moderate-to-low income levels, residents are price-sensitive to both transit fares and sales taxes. Many households need to carefully budget discretionary spending
thinking.accessibility: Well-served by CTA Brown Line, multiple bus routes, and major arterial roads. About 36% of residents use public transit for commuting, 45% drive, indicating balanced modal split. Many residents depend on both transit and driving
thinking.decision_rationale: 1. Prioritize lower transit fares and moderate tax rates given income constraints. 2. Balance driving fees to improve transit service without overly burdening drivers. 3. Consider proposals that reduce transit travel time since many residents use transit. 4. Look for options that maintain reasonable car travel times for driving commuters. 5. Selected proposals 10, 11, 13, 19, and 20 as they offer good balance of lower fares, moderate taxes, and improved travel times for both modes
